CONCLUSION: Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG The PERSON case was referred to the ORG on CARDINAL DATE by ORG ( " the Commission " ) . The case originated in an application ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) against GPE lodged with ORG on DATE by CARDINAL NORP nationals , Mr. PERSON and his wife PERSON .

CARDINAL . ORG By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG found a breach of LAW ( article DATE ) of the LAW in that the applicants had not received a hearing within a reasonable time ( Series A no . CARDINAL , point CARDINAL of the operative provisions and paragraphs CARDINAL of the reasons , pp . CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) .

The only outstanding matter to be settled is the question of the application of LAW ) in the present case . Accordingly , as regards the facts the ORG will confine itself here to giving the pertinent details ; for further particulars , reference should be made to DATE of the above - mentioned judgment ( ibid . , pp . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . ORG At the hearings on DATE , counsel for the applicants stated that , should the ORG find a violation of the LAW , his clients would be claiming just satisfaction under LAW ) for the prejudice suffered as a result of the unreasonable length of the proceedings and possibly for legal costs ; he did not , however , quantify their claims . ORG ( " the Government " ) did not take a stand on the matter .

In its judgment of DATE , the ORG reserved the whole of this question . The ORG was invited to submit to the ORG , within DATE , its written observations and , in particular , to notify ORG of any friendly settlement at which the ORG and the applicants might have arrived ( see point CARDINAL of the operative provisions and paragraph CARDINAL of the reasons , ibid . , p. CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . ORG After CARDINAL extension of the above - mentioned time - limit by the President of the ORG and in accordance with his Orders and directions , the registry received :
- on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE , through the Secretary to ORG , the ORG ’s and the applicants’ respective observations ;
- on DATE , DATE and DATE , the ORG ’s comments .
These documents revealed that no friendly settlement had been reached .

CARDINAL . ORG By letter dated DATE , which was received at DATE , the lawyer for Mr. and Mrs. PERSON informed the PERSON that he was no longer representing them ; on DATE , they instructed Mr. PERSON as their lawyer .

CARDINAL . ORG Mr. PERSON , substitute judge , took the place of Mr. PERSON , who was prevented from taking further part in the consideration of the case ( Rules CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of ORG ) .
CARDINAL . ORG After consulting , through ORG , the Agent of the Government and ORG , the ORG decided on CARDINAL DATE that there was no call to hold hearings .
